text: Roebuck "Pops" Staples (December 28, 1914 â€“ December 19, 2000) was an American Gospel and R&B; musician. He was the patriarch and member of singing group The Staple Singers. In 1998 he received a National Heritage Fellowship from the National Endowment for the Arts, which is the highest honor in the folk and traditional arts in the United States. Staples was buried in Oak Woods Cemetery in Greater Grand Crossing, Chicago. ==References== ==Other websites== * Pops Staples website Category:Accidental deaths from falls Category:1914 births Category:2000 deaths Category:People with Alzheimer's disease Category:Burials at Oak Woods Cemetery Category:American gospel musicians Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American R&B; singers Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:Singers from Mississippi Category:Singers from Chicago Category:Musicians from Chicago
title: Pops Staples
